meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be substituted for one another.
meanings.sent1: The substitutabilities of these two items make them interchangeable.
meanings.sent2: In cooking, the substitutabilities of ingredients allow for flexibility in recipes.
meanings.sent3: The substitutabilities of the actors in the play led to a hilarious mix-up on stage.
meanings.sent4: Her quick thinking and substitutabilities in problem-solving saved the day.
meanings.sent5: The teacher explained the substitutabilities of synonyms using fun examples.

meanings.definition: The ability to be replaced or exchanged with something else.
meanings.sent1: When shopping, always consider the substitutabilities of products to find the best deal.
meanings.sent2: The substitutabilities of currencies make international trade easier.
meanings.sent3: The substitutabilities of the missing puzzle piece with a cookie made the game more interesting.
meanings.sent4: His adaptability and substitutabilities in different roles impressed the director.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the substitutabilities of tools can help in various DIY projects.
